intro: Asperugo alba, commonly known as the white asperugo, is a flowering plant native to parts of Europe and Asia. It belongs to the family Apiaceae, which includes carrots and parsley, and is characterized by its finely divided, fern-like leaves. The plant produces small, white flowers that bloom in clusters, typically from late spring to early summer. Asperugo alba is often found in moist, shaded environments such as woodland edges and stream banks. Its botanical features make it an interesting subject for ecological studies and herbal medicine.
